description:
These commits:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc,n,z

mean we're using an oslo-config tarball from tarballs.openstack.org

Once oslo.config-1.1.0 has been published to pypi, we should switch to:

  oslo.config>=1.1.0
title: Use oslo-config 1.1.0 release

comments.content:
These commits:

  https://review.openstack.org/#/q/I4815aeb8a9341a31a250e920157f15ee15cfc5bc,n,z

mean we're using an oslo-config tarball from tarballs.openstack.org

Once oslo-config-2013.1 has been published to pypi, we should switch to:

  oslo-config>=2013.1
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~markmc

comments.content:
Currently blocking on  blocking on  https://review.openstack.org/24168 and https://review.openstack.org/24169

Fallback plan is that I'll push 1.1.0 to PyPI directly myself

commit 60842f6a02cf4c078a2f1971444efd9f97ead991
Author: Mark McLoughlin <email address hidden>
Date:   Tue Mar 12 16:24:41 2013 +0000

    Switch to final 1.1.0 oslo.config release
    
    Fixes bug #1128256
    
    oslo.config has now been released to PyPI in time for Grizzly RC1 so
    we can switch to using it directly.
    
    Change-Id: I655f831718ae5f4e25e941ee206fe195214a9a91
